class_notes:
FREN 314 What is Interpretation?
Vessier (TT 11:30-12:45 in person)
Content: This course is designed to teach students the vocabulary and analytical techniques necessary for the study of cultural artifacts, including poetry, prose, drama, and selected visual materials. Prerequisite: FREN 310W or by permission. 
 
Class Notes: The theme of this course is the environment. Through a variety of texts across the history of literature and philosophy in French, and spanning numerous genres of writing and regions of the French-speaking world, we will investigate the numerous modes, manifestations and discourses related to the environment, as well as its integral relation to aesthetics, climate change, race, gender and thought. Taught in French.
course_description: An introduction to the reading and interpretation of a variety of literary and cultural media including poetry, drama, prose fiction, political writings, publicity, films, painting, and architecture.
prerequisites: FREN 310 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
